description: Robust stochastic policy for Experiment 2b (Bank A), iteration 4. Posts full collateral at the start of the day and uses a very permissive, deadline-aware liquidity rule: release almost all payments early, holding back only the very largest non-urgent payments when liquidity is extremely tight. This prioritizes eliminating EOD unsettled transactions while retaining a thin liquidity buffer for robustness.

strategic_collateral_tree.description: At the start of the day, post the full collateral capacity to maximize liquidity available for settlement and minimize the risk of EOD unsettled payments.

payment_tree.description: More aggressive deadline-aware release rule. Treat payments as urgent earlier in the day and release them immediately to avoid late-day bunching and EOD non-settlement.

on_true.description: Payment is within the wider urgency window; release immediately to reduce the backlog and protect against EOD unsettled payments.

on_false.description: For non-urgent payments, apply only a very thin liquidity buffer so that almost all payments are released early, holding back only the very largest ones when liquidity is extremely tight.

on_true.description: Effective liquidity comfortably covers the payment amount with only a 5% buffer, so release now to keep flows circulating and minimize EOD risk.

on_false.description: Liquidity is extremely tight relative to this large non-urgent payment; hold it temporarily to avoid exhausting all liquidity on a single item while smaller payments continue to settle.
